dialog: Subtitles by explosiveskull Do you know what time it is?
Yeah, but then I'd be sleeping.
Right, you slipped as a result of me punching you in the face.
I was already slipping when you happened to punch me in the face.
The two events were not related.
You have to let go of the past.
It's causing you doubt, and doubt makes you vulnerable.
Lose control again, and you'll have to commune with the Supreme Intelligence.
There's nothing more dangerous to a warrior than emotion.
One hundred twenty days since the last Skrull attack.
Has anyone ever seen what the Supreme Intelligence really looks like?
No one can look upon the Supreme Intelligence in its true form.
Our subconscious chooses the way they appear to us.
It's me you see, isn't it?
I see what you're trying to do.
But you won't succeed in changing the subject.
What is the point of giving me these...
if you don't want me to use them?
I want you to use them.
The Supreme Intelligence gave me a responsibility...
of showing you how to use them.
Yeah, if that were true, you'd be able to knock me down without them.
Stop using this, start using this.
I want you to be the best version of yourself.
Your commander insists that you're fit to serve.
with your past, which fuels them.
You are just one victim of the Skrull expansion...
that has threatened our civilization for centuries.
and so much that you do not.
You're supposed to take the form of who I most admire...
but I don't even remember who this person was to me.
Perhaps this is a mercy sparing you from a deeper pain.
Freeing you to do what all Kree must...
put your people's needs before your own.
We've given you a great gift.
The chance to fight for the good of all Kree.
What was given can be taken away.
Has a Skrull ever simmed you?
Because I stared into the face of my mortal enemy...
and the face staring back was my own.
Maybe if you were more attractive, then it would be less disturbing.
You think you're funny, but I'm not laughing.
It's funny 'cause, objectively speaking, you're quite handsome.
a search and rescue of our spy, SohLarr.
The Skrulls have invaded yet another border planet.
The signal was intercepted, and his cover's blown.
The Skrull general, Talos, has sent kill units to find him.
Should they reach him before we do...
the intelligence he's acquired over three years is as good as theirs.
The Accusers will bomb a Skrull stronghold here in the south.
We slip in, we locate SohLarr...
and we get out, leaving them none the wiser.
We are not to interfere with them, nor them with us.
Nothing compromises the security of our mission.
We must all be ready to join the Collective if that is our fate today.
For the good of all Kree.
For the good of all Kree!
His beacon's coming from that temple. Let's move.
No. This is a perfect spot for an ambush.
Only one way in, only one way out.
We can get past the locals.
We don't know if they are locals.
You don't have to go with me. I'll go alone.
Right. We keep a close radius.
We lose comms, we meet back at the Helion.
Do you have eyes on this?
I found two dead. No green.
How did you know the code?
How about I tell you my secret...
About to show these boys how we do it.
What the hell are you thinking?
I think we went back too far.
Am I the only one that's confused here?
You do know why they call it a cockpit, don't you?
A huge rumble throughout the cosmos shook the moon...
and the sun and the stars in the sky.
And so, little Alouette flew up throughout the night.
Get your butts inside, it's time to eat.
She doesn't typically take to people.
I can't sleep when there's work to do.
Flying your planes never feels like work.
I prefer the view from up there.
You'll get there soon enough, Ace.
I prefer the view from up there.
You'll get there soon enough, Ace.
I prefer the view from up there.
Now track Lawson until we find the energy signature.
Now let me see where you're headed.
Do we have any information we can act on?
Just that Lawson was somewhere on planet C53.
Lawson is our link to that lightspeed engine!
What did you do to me?
Now we're just after a little information.
What did you put in my head?
Yeah, it's like a bad trip, isn't it?
I'm not surprised you can't keep it straight.
They really did a number on you.
We're looking for the location of a Dr. Lawson...
I don't know any Dr. Lawson.
Really? Then why is she in your head?
You guys wouldn't happen to know how these things come off, would ya?
You do know why they call it a...
We're just getting to know each other.
Vers to Starforce command, do you read me?
Do you understand me? Is my universal translator working?
Are you in charge of security for this district?
Sort of. Uh, the movie theater has its own guy.
Where can I find communications equipment?
She knows more than she knows.
And I'm fine, thank you for asking.
That code was buried in his unconscious.
The Skrulls messed with my mind.
I think it's how they extracted SohLarr's code.
The Skrulls are looking for someone named Lawson.
They think that she's cracked the code on lightspeed tech.
I have to get to her before they do...
or else they'll be able to invade new galaxies.
No. You've been caught once already.
Vers, hold your position until we get there.
Keep your comms online so we can contact you.
No! What if they get a hold of it before...
A longdistance company access code is required for the number you have dialed.
Please dial your call with the access code.
If the Skrulls got to her, she's compromised.
You know anything about a lady blowing a hole...
through the roof of that Blockbuster over there?
Witness says she was dressed for laser tag.
Yeah, I think she went that way.
Uh, I'd like to ask you some questions.
Maybe give you the 411 on the latenight drop box.
Could I see some identification, please?
We don't carry our identification on little cards.
How long you plan to be in town?
oh, I'll be out of your hair...
as soon as I track down the Skrulls that are infiltrating your planet.
They can transform into any lifeform down to the DNA.
Oh, boy. You guys don't have any clue, do you?
How do we know you're not one of those shapeshifters?
You have finally asked a relevant question.
No! Congratulations to you, Starforce lady.
"Trust me, true believer." "Trust me." "Trust me, true believer." Get off!
Train's heading for a tunnel up ahead.
Let's greet them at the station.
Mr. Fury, this is Agent Coulson.
Uh, I'm still here at the Blockbuster.
All life on Earth is carbonbased. Not this guy.
Whatever he runs on, it's not on the periodic table.
You're saying he's not from around here?
but it can't believe what it's seeing.
You say this thing looked like Coulson?
And the woman said that there were more?
The word she used was "infiltration." You believe her?
I got word on a motorcycle thief that fits her description.
If she can tell us why these lizards are here...
maybe she can tell us how to kick 'em to the curb.
Wow. They're ugly bastards, aren't they?
Yeah, well, he's no Brad Pitt, sir.
Safe journey to the beyond, my friend.
I will finish what we started.
I wouldn't get too close there, boss.
Not unlike the file I started on you.
But I see you've changed it up a bit since then.
Grunge is a good look for you.
Did you have a rough day, Agent Fury?
Had a space invasion, big car chase.
Got to watch an alien autopsy.
I was never one to believe in aliens...
This is gonna get a little awkward, but I gotta ask.
You think I'm one of those green things.
You are looking at I'm afraid I'm gonna need proof.
We talking cheek swab or urine sample?
Skrulls can only sim recent memories  of their host bodies.
But technically, I don't remember that part.
Soldier. Straight out of high school.
Left the ranks a full bird colonel.
Been riding a desk for the past six years...
trying to figure out where our future enemies are coming from.
Never occurred to me they would be coming from above.
Name a detail so bizarre a Skrull could never fabricate it.
If toast is cut diagonally, I can't eat it.
You didn't need that, did you?
And how is that supposed to prove to me you're not a Skrull?
So, a full bird colonel turned spy turned S.H.I.E.L.D. agent...
must have pretty high security clearance.
The Skrulls sim alien races to infiltrate and take over planets.
So, um, what do Skrulls want with Dr. Lawson?
They believe that she developed a lightspeed engine at Pegasus.
Gotta admit, that's not the craziest thing I've heard today.
And you, what do you want?
To stop the Skrulls before they become unstoppable.
Look, war is a universal language.
I know a rogue soldier when I see one.
You got a personal stake in this.
Place your thumb on the pad.
What does your mom call you?
If I have them, they'll call me Fury.
You look like somebody's disaffected niece.
Does, uh, announcing your identity on clothing help with the covert part of your job?
Said the space soldier who was wearing a rubber suit.
We're looking for a woman named Lawson.
You familiar with the phrase "welcome wagon"?
Oh, you should see what I can do with a paperclip.
Oh, my goodness. Look at you.
Aren't you the cutest little thing?
"Goose." Cool name for a cool cat.
Oh! Let me get my fingerprint out.
Just let me unravel this puppy.
You sat there and watched me play with tape?
When all you had to do was...
I didn't wanna steal your thunder.
Lawson's plan for the lightspeed engine.
I wonder why they terminated the project.
She crashed the Asis aircraft doing an unauthorized test flight.
Took a pilot down with her.
That's why security here is so unfriendly.
They're covering up a billiondollar mistake.
Oh, and your lightspeed engine is toast.
Um, most of this thing's redacted...
but there is a testimonial here from a Maria Rambeau.
Last person to see them alive.
She was here on C53 and died in a plane crash.
Do you know anything about this?
I just discovered a mission report sent from C53.
There's only so much I'm cleared to tell you, Vers, but...
Lawson was an undercover Kree operative named MarVell.
She was working on a unique energy core.
Experimenting with tech that apparently could help us win the war.
She's cooperating with the investigation, sir.
I want to question her alone.
Does it say anything about me?
I found evidence that I had a life here.
MarVell is who I see when I visit the Supreme Intelligence.
And I knew her as Lawson.
This sounds like Skrull simulation, Vers.
No, it's not. Because I remember.
Do not let your emotions override your judgment.
and take the stairs in case she makes a run for it.
Do a pincer move like we did in Havana.
Right. Like we did in Havana.
Leave your beacon on so I can find you.
We'll get to the bottom of this, Vers.
Then why would he call us in?
All I know is we take him in, too.
Now, you know, I don't really need these to see...
but they do kinda complete the look.
Coulson, do you have eyes on them?
You obviously can't be trusted with it.
Do you know how to fly this thing?
That's a yes or no question.
You the good kitty, that's right.
I arrived on Hala near dead.
So, you think you're the pilot that went down with Dr. Lawson?
I'm saying the last person to see them alive could probably tell us.
So, how do we get to Louisiana?
that stopped the Skrulls from finding us?
I guess he doesn't hate me yet.
I guess he had a feeling, you know?
Went with his gut against orders.
That's a really hard thing to do.
But it's what keeps us human.
I get in trouble for that.
Oh, I can see that about you.
Rescuing the guy who sold you out to the Skrulls?
I'm guessing that's not standard Kree operating procedure.
Well, I won't tell your boss if you don't tell mine.
but the greater mission was a failure, thanks to your team.
It was a trap to lure our operative Vers to Torfa and kidnap her.
We'll take care of the terrorist threat.
By bombing them out of the galaxy?
A cell of Skrulls anywhere is a threat to Kree everywhere.
Excuse me, I'm looking for Maria Rambeau.
But we knew they were lying.
I'm not really who you think I am.
That is the craziest shit I ever heard.
You are absolutely right, young lady.
'Cause if there were, we would want to keep that to ourselves.
Oh, she can do a lot more than make tea with those hands.
You want to give her a hand with that?
But I can't tell what's real.
If I could just piece together what happened that morning...
You woke me up banging on my door at dawn.
Back then, we had to get up so early.
The Air Force still wasn't letting women fly combat...
so testing Lawson's planes was our only shot at doing something that mattered.
You wanted to race to base in your old Mustang...
and I wasn't about to argue, 'cause I knew my Camaro would dominate.
But you cheated, took a shortcut.
Since when is a shortcut cheating?
Since it violates the predetermined rules of engagement.
When I got to the hangar, Lawson was agitated.
She said she had lives to save.
She was trying to take the Asis up herself, but you said that...
If there were lives at stake, I would fly the plane.
The kind of moment we'd both been waiting for.
But now you're saying she's from another planet.
I know this must be hard for you.
Oh, what's hard is losing my best friend...
in a mission so secret they act like it never even happened.
Hard is knowing you were out there somewhere too damn stubborn to die.
And now you come up in here after six years...
and you expect me to call you...
Is that really who you are now?
This is me and you on Halloween.
I'm Amelia Earhart and you're Janis Joplin.
Oh, this is you when you were little.
You didn't get along with your parents...
so Mom said we became your real family.
I got my favorite bunny slippers.
This is another picture of you when you were little.
You've always wanted to be a pilot.
And this is right after you graduated.
This was your dog that you got for Christmas...
This is a picture of everybody from your Air Force team.
And this is you with Mom right after a good day of training.
These were your three favorite guys.
Mom doesn't let me wear it anymore after I spilled ketchup on it.
That was all that survived the crash.
Static electricity out here's no joke.
I noticed that peculiar bird you got parked by the road...
if you mind if I bring the boys over to get a closer looksee?
To see the "bird" parked out by the road?
You're really working overtime to sell this one, aren't you, Talos?
This really isn't a good time.
You know, you really should be kinder to your neighbors.
You never know when you're gonna need to borrow some sugar.
Before you go swinging those jazz hands around...
making a mess of your friend's house...
No one's gonna hurt the girl.
That would really complicate the situation.
I'm about five seconds from complicating that wall with some uglyass Skrull brains.
I'm sorry I simmed your boss.
But now I stand before you as my true self.
And who is that out there?
but I'm sure that you understand I had to take some precautions.
I saw you crush with your hands bound.
Last time we talked, I ended up hanging from my ankles.
That was before I knew who you were.
Before I knew what made you different from the others.
I have an audio recording from Pegasus...
of your voice from a plane crash six years ago...
on a device I believe you call a "black box." They told me it was destroyed in the crash.
Young lady, I have a special skill...
that kind of allows me to get into places I'm not supposed to be.
I'm gonna put my foot in a place it's not supposed to be.
Am I supposed to guess where that is?
Okay, I get it. We're all a little on edge here.
But, look, I just need your help decoding some coordinates.
If you'll sit down and you'll listen to this...
I assure you, it'll be worth your while.
Call your buddy back inside and I'll listen.
This isn't what you're afraid of, is it?
It's not showing up on my radar.
I never should have brought you along.
Bail out! Bail out! Bail out!
Carol, come in. Do you copy?
Yeah, but, uh, how's my hair?
I gotta destroy it before they get here.
You remember what I said about our work here?
Yeah. But the wars are bigger than you know.
My real name is MarVell, and I come from a planet called Hala.
I would say that you're delusional...
but we just got shot down by a spaceship and your blood is blue.
Listen, I spent half my life fighting a shameful war.
Now, skedaddle before you give me any more regrets.
Now I gotta blow this engine before they find it.
We have no interest in hurting you.
'Cause all the shooting kinda gave me the wrong impression!
You have two minutes until you're surrounded.
Then I see no reason to prolong this conversation.
Everything that I knew was a lie.
'cause she found out that she was on the wrong side of an unjust war.
I saw the ruins on Torfa.
Ruins that the Accusers are responsible for.
My people lived as refugees on Torfa.
Homeless, ever since we resisted Kree rule...
And the handful of us that are left will be slaughtered next...
unless you help me finish what MarVell started.
The core that she found would have powered a lightspeed ship...
capable of carrying us to safety.
A new home where the Kree can't reach us.
Lawson always told us that our work at Pegasus wasn't to fight wars...
She wanted you to help us find the core.
The core that powered it is in a remote location.
If you help us decode those coordinates...
You'll use it to destroy us.
You and I lost everything at the hands of the Kree.
You have no idea who I am.
I don't even know who I am!
You are the woman on that black box risking her life to do the right thing.
who supported me as a mother and a pilot when no one else did.
You are smart, and funny, and a huge pain in the ass...
and you were the most powerful person I knew...
way before you could shoot fire from your fists.
I know I don't deserve your trust...
but you were our only lead.
We discovered that your energy signature matched MarVell's core.
If only you knew the importance of it to me.
I just need your help decoding the coordinates to MarVell's lab.
You didn't find her lab on Earth, 'cause it's not on Earth.
That was the location on the date of the crash six years ago.
If we track its course, we'll find it in orbit right now.
Was that so difficult to figure out?
I mean, you're my science guy, right?
YonRogg will catch up to me soon.
We've got to get to the core before he does.
A few tweaks to your vessel should do it.
Well, I could use a copilot.
Mom, it's okay. I can stay with Gramma and Pawpaw.
There's no way I'm going, baby. It's too dangerous.
Testing brandnew aerospace tech is dangerous...
and you used to do that.
Your plan is to leave the atmosphere in a craft not designed for the journey...
You have a chance to fly the coolest mission in the history of missions...
and you're gonna give it up to sit on the couch and watch Fresh Prince with me?
I just think you should consider...
what kind of example you're setting for your daughter.
When they were handing out kids, they gave her the toughest one.
You hang on to it until I come back.
But there is something that I need your help with.
I can't wear these Kree colors anymore.
And since you are obviously the only person around here with any sense of style...
Well, since we're on the same team...
That system is fallible, as we've learned.
Who do I see when I commune with the Supreme Intelligence?
The person you most admire and respect, I'd guess.
But you would never tell me who.
And what is your earliest memory of Hala?
Blue blood running through my veins.
That's my blood that's coursing through her veins.
What have you done with her?
For the good of all Kree, Commander...
You know, you really shouldn't have that thing on your lap.
Our little alliance with you is tenuous at best.
And as long as he continues to freak you out...
yeah, I'm gonna keep giving him all the loves and hugs that he needs, right?
Do you just turn into anything you want?
Ah, well, I have to see it first.
and, um, dare I say it, talent to do it well.
Can you turn into a cat?
Why would I turn into a filing cabinet?
I'll give you if you turn into a Venus flytrap.
Switching engines from Scramjet to Fusion.
Is this normal, like, space turbulence?
Well, is it in front of all that nothing, or behind it?
In her notes she called it the Tesseract.
What was Lawson doing with all this kid stuff?
He didn't come here for the Tesseract.
We didn't know what to do.
MarVell warned us not to send a signal for any reason...
or the Kree would find us.
I am not gonna hurt you.
My hands are filthy from it, too.
There are thousands of us separated from each other...
If I played the same pinball machine for six years...
I'd have some high scores, too.
What did you do to your uniform?
The Supreme Intelligence will set her straight.
You can see they're not soldiers.
I made you the best version of yourself.
What's given can be taken away.
Seems like your time on C53 jogged the old memory.
If you hurt them, I will burn you to the ground.
You didn't give me these powers.
And yet, you've never had the strength to control them on your own.
It's a cat, not Hannibal Lecter.
Load the Flerken onto the Helion.
those insidious shapeshifters will threaten our borders no more.
I used to believe your lies...
but the Skrulls are just fighting for a home.
You're talking about destroying them because they won't submit to your rule.
We embraced you as our own.
From my home, my family, my friends.
It's cute how hard you try.
Are you trying to kill yourself?
You're too emotional and so weak.
This ain't  a game for little girls.
You won't last a week, Danvers.
I've been fighting with one arm tied behind my back.
You want me to get you an oven mitt?
Get the Skrulls on the Quadjet and go.
I'm trusting you not to eat me.
I used to find you amusing.
Let's put an end to this.
Is that why we never hung out?
No, I just never liked you.
Take them to the hangar, too.
We'll blast them all into space.
I could have swore I put it in there.
MinnErva, take them down in the drop ship.
We got a bogey coming in hot.
C53 doesn't have a defense system advanced enough to destroy our warheads.
That's not their defense system, Ronan.
We'll be back for the weapon.
You've come a long way since I found you that day by the lake.
But can you keep your emotions in check long enough to take me on?
Or will they get the better of you as always?
you'll be ready the day you can knock me down as yourself.
and prove to me you can beat me without...
I have nothing to prove to you.
I'm sending you with a message.
Tell the Supreme Intelligence that I'm coming to end it.
That was a close call, huh, Goosey? Huh?
Those bad guys still in there somewhere?
I can't believe you got in the raddest dogfight ever...
I'd say you arrived just in time.
Some nifty flying you did out there.
S.H.I.E.L.D. could always use a good pilot like you.
as long as you never call my flying "nifty" again.
He tied my boss up, stole his identity.
It is a little like stealing.
Whose side are you on here?
You're good to go here until you recover...
but you and your family are gonna need a new look.
I could go back to being your boss.
Come on. I loved sporting his beautiful blue eyes.
You guys have the best eyes.
I was trying not to panic...
I'll help you find a home.
They can stay here with us.
They won't be safe here, baby.
I'll be back before you know it.
Or maybe I could fly up and meet you halfway?
Ah, only if you learn to glow like your Auntie Carol.
Or maybe I'll build a spaceship.
You sure that's what Marvel would want?
Maybe it'll come back to me.
Range should be a couple galaxies, at least.
What? You think I'm gonna crank call you?
if you're ever passing back through this galaxy...
be sure to give a brother a shout.
We got the ketchup stain off.
It's hard for me to say goodbye, too.
Glad to have you back, sir.
That the Kree burned your eye out...
because you refused to give them the Tesseract?
I will neither confirm nor deny the facts of that story.
I'm sorry to report that we still haven't found the Tesseract.
I'm sure it'll turn up somewhere.
I'll let you know when it does.
We have no idea what other intergalactic threats are out there.
And our onewoman security force had a prior commitment...
on the other side of the universe.
You think you can find others like her?
Hmm, we found her, and we weren't even looking.
You got a big decision to make.
So, that thing just stopped doing whatever the hell it was doing.
Whatever signal it was sending finally crapped out.
I thought we bypassed the battery.
We don't even know what this is.
You tell me the second you get a signal.
I wanna know who's on the other end of that thing.
